headline: MSG Maker Pushes To Redefine a Term Tied to Restaurants
abstract: The leading maker of MSG started a push to ask Merriam-Webster to change its definition of the term, first added in 1993.
lead_paragraph: Merriam-Webster added “Chinese restaurant syndrome” to its dictionaries in 1993. The definition described symptoms affecting “susceptible persons eating food and especially Chinese food heavily seasoned with monosodium glutamate.”
